title: Where are the sound and image files for the new client if I opt in?
body: eg: If I wanted to change Teemo's portrait in the store, where would I find it? Or if I wanted to change the champion select music, where do I find it?

replies.body: We don't support making modifications to the game or client, so I couldn't really tell you.  Be really careful about doing something like this, as it might result in crashes or issues that we won't be able to support.  It's not worth, imo!

> [{quoted}](name=Porocles,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=80c7jntv,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-25T19:25:51.564+0000)
>
> We don't support making modifications to the game or client, so I couldn't really tell you.  Be really careful about doing something like this, as it might result in crashes or issues that we won't be able to support.  It's not worth, imo!

I've been doing it for months with the old client.

I run league from a RAM-disk and I like it to be as small as possible.

The only reason I opted into the new client was so I could delete the old one (and I did it in a way that will HOPEFULLY not trigger the files as corrupt as far as the patcher is concerned - by replacing every file with a 0 byte file with the same name):

http://i.imgur.com/8OqbRw3.png/img

http://i.imgur.com/w0C4Vcn.png/img

Now with my "legacy client" completely deleted, I would like to also shrink my beta client (by replacing jpeg images with super lossy pixelated compressed versions of themselves, and muting/shrinking the sounds by replacing them with 1 second of silence - which is what I had been doing with the old client for months).

I don't care if it's "not supported" - I just want to know how to do it. It won't crash or cause issues. I know what I'm doing.
